Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Skelmersdale is a town in West Lancashire, located 7 miles west of Wigan, 13 miles north east of Liverpool and 18 miles south of Preston.  Skelmersdale’s town centre is made up of the Concourse Shopping Centre which is a multi-level shopping and leisure scheme.  
The subject property occupies a position just off the main mall adjacent to the British Heart Foundation and Wilko with Poundland being in the immediate vicinity.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The subject property comprises a ground floor (upper level) banking hall, with basement (lower level) ancillary accommodation comprising a staffroom, safe and male and female WCs.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 19/10/2025. 
Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £30,000 per annum, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable value of the property is £30,250. The UBR for 2021/2022 is 49.9p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The site is located in the heart of The Buckshaw Village, a new suburban village located circa 2.5 miles north of Chorley Town Centre and 3 miles south of Leyland. Buckshaw Village is easily accessible from Junction 8 of
the M61 (2 miles to the east). Buckshaw Village is a new residential town of circa 3,000 homes and vast commercial areas and is considered to be one of the largest new urban development areas within the UK.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The site comprises a broadly flat rectangular parcel of land sandwiched between KFC Drive Thru and Greene King’s Hungry Horse Pub, a desirable residential housing estate, Roundhouse Court trade Park and Buckshaw
Village Square. Phase 2 comprises the last remaining prime development plot in Buckshaw Village centre which our client is seeking to develop in 2019 / 2020 for occupiers. Existing access is provided via Barnes Wallis Way to the rear of the site. Our client as experienced developers are willing to consider a range of development options including:
• 3 x 2,800 sq ft units or a single combined stand alone unit of approx 8,100 sq ft with 25 delineated car parking spaces and landscaped areas.
• Overall size, layout and scheme variation are flexible and can be reviewed in accordance with Tenant specifications and statutory consents.

Tenure
The unit(s) are available by way of new effective full repairing and insuring leases for a term to be agreed.

Rent
On application. The rent is exclusive of VAT, business rates, insurance and service charge.

Rates
To be assessed.

Buckshaw Village, a new suburban village located 2.5 miles north of Chorley town centre and 3 miles south of Leyland. Buckshaw Village is a new residential and commercial development area and is considered one of the largest new urban development areas within the UK. 

The subject development is located in the commercial centre adjacent to KFC, Tesco, Lidl, Harvester, Hungry Horse pub, Costa Coffee, Bet Sid and Domino's stores.  

The KFC drive thru under Phase 1 has now opened. Phase 2 marketing has now commenced for 3 x 2,700 sq ft units with 25 parking spaces. The completed units would suit a range of business, light industrial and office uses but could suit a range of alternative uses including A3 bar restaurant, A4 public house, D1 healthcare, educational uses including children’s day nursery together with D2 Leisure i.e. gym. Any alternative uses to be considered would be subject to planning consent and individual occupier requirements.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Phase 2 - Munro Court, Buckshaw Village, Chorley

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property occupies a prominent position on Friargate in Preston. The city is located in Lancashire, approximately 17 miles east of Blackpool and 34 miles north-west of Manchester. National retailers in the vicinity include McDonald’s, Caffe Nero, Patisserie Valeria and STA Travel.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The unit is arranged over ground floor only as comprises sale area, staff counter, staff room and W/C’s.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 07/05/2027.

Rent
The current passing rent is £39,375 exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £40,000.00 and the rates payable are £19,640.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The subject property is situated in prominent location close to the west entrance to St. Johns Shopping Centre. The scheme is anchored by B&M Bargains and other retailers within the scheme include Heron and Card Factory.

The property is directly opposite the proposed new Cinema and Restaurant scheme on the former Market Hall site, which is expected to drive substantial footfall to the immediate area.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over ground and first floor. The ground floor comprises a banking hall, interview rooms and office space. The first floor provides ancillary storage space, a kitchen and a WC.

Tenure
The property is held on an existing FRI lease due to expire 17/03/2026 with a break option on 17/03/2021.
Offers accepted on the basis of assignment or sub-lease at the passing rent of £31,000 per annum exclusive.

Service Charge
Available on request

Rates
We understand from the VOA website that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £36,500 and the rates payable are £17,921.50 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.1p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.
